intro: Bomarea sclerophylla, commonly known as the hard-leaved bomarea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Alstroemeriaceae. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its dense, woody stems and narrow, leathery leaves that are adapted to dry conditions. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, with a striking violet or purple coloration. Bomarea sclerophylla is often found in rocky or arid habitats, showcasing its resilience to harsh environmental conditions.
